metadata.title: CVE-2014-1583 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The Alarm API in Mozilla Firefox before 33.0 and Firefox ESR 31.x before31.2 does not properly restrict toJSON calls, which allows remote attackersto bypass the Same Origin Policy via crafted API calls that accesssensitive information within the JSON data of an alarm.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
